oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Rearing calves with cows: Nature works!
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wageninaar, Jan-Paul
Langhout, Jos
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Health and welfare
Feeding and growth
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: One of the objectives of the research project "Cows with calves" ('Kalveren bij de Koe') is to develop a rearing method that gives the natural bond between mother cow and calf a function. At the same time the rearing method also needs to be ﬁnancially and practically viable. In order to assess the applicability of rearing cows with calves a wide range of parameters was monitored: liveweight development of calves, behaviour of animals that suckle or suckled as a calf, milk production, calf milk consumption and animal health. These data and experiences were used to try and deﬁne the best conditions for rearing cows with calves.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Wageninaar, Jan-Paul and Langhout, Jos (2006) Rearing calves with cows: Nature works! LBI Publications, no. LV60E. Louis Bolk Instituut.
